hints.content:
We know the $\blueD{\text{number of groups}}$:

There are $\blueD{5}$ chocolate bars.

And we know the $\purpleC{\text{size of the groups}}$:

Each bar is split into $\purpleC8$ pieces.

The product will tell us the $\greenD{\text{total}}$.

In this problem, the $\greenD{\text{total}}$ is the $\greenD{\text{total number of pieces in all bars}}$.
The product tells us the $\greenD{\text{total number of pieces in all bars}}$.

question.content:
There are $5$ chocolate bars. Each bar is split into $8$ pieces. 

**What does the expression $5\times8$ represent?**

choices.content: Total number of pieces in all bars
